intro: Acmadenia, commonly known as the mistflower or rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. These shrubs are native to Australia and are characterized by their small, often fragrant flowers and leathery leaves. They typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Acmadenia plants play a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small fauna.
